column8:
This t-shirt admires the 1st Duke of Wellington, Arthur Wellesley.

Wellesley was born in 1769 and had a distinguished career in the military, fighting in 7 different campaigns including the Battle of Waterloo. He received many awards for his efforts and in 1787, Arthur Wellesley became Prime Minister of England.

This design uses a great quote of Wellington; after one of his significant military conquests, Arthur held a banquet. As he entered the room everyone stood and broke into applause. Wellington continued to his seat and with the applause still in full flow raised his hands to calm the throng saying:  'Please no applause, it is too close to the expression of an opinion'.
column21: As portrayed by Stephen Fry in Blackadder, The Iron Duke was a formidable figure, and a brilliant soldier and prime minister. This t-shirt celebrates one of his most brilliantly cutting remarks.
